name: You Get Ten Points 'Per' Word! Online Quiz | Humanities | 25 Questions

questions.text: What is something an employee might receive in addition to a regular salary?
questions.explanation:
perquisite & perquisites.

	These are also known as 'perks.'

pert.

	Jonathan Swift wrote: 'Damp the pert!' I guess it means something similar to 'Take some of the wind out of bratty, cocky people's sails.'

persnickety & pernickety.

	'Persnickety' really sounds like its meaning.

permutation.

	This is a math term, too.

questions.text: This one doesn't begin with 'per.' A noun that's a synonym for 'specialist' or 'authority'?
questions.explanation:
expert.

	Are you an expert at quiz taking or quiz making (or both)?

questions.text: This one doesn't start with 'per.' A synonym for 'insolent' or 'impudent'?
questions.explanation:
impertinent.

	Antonyms might be 'respectful' and 'docile.'

questions.text: The one-word title of a Jane Austen novel?
questions.explanation:
Persuasion.

	If you like Jane Austen, please take some JA quizzes in the Literature section.

questions.text: Try to see the situation from the other person's _______.
questions.explanation:
perspective.

	Perspective is also something that architectural drawings have to have.

Perth.

	There's also a Perth in Ontario, Canada, and one in Scotland. I imagine that the Australian and Canadian Perths were named for the Scottish one.

Peru.

	Peruvian artisans produce beautiful work.

questions.text: What is the name of the mother dog in '101 Dalmatians'?
questions.explanation:
Perdita.

	The name means 'lost one.'

questions.text: Very tolerant or lenient--perhaps too much so?
questions.explanation:
permissive.

	My own mother was fairly permissive, but I was a 'goody two shoes', so it didn't matter.

questions.text: The name of a company that bottles fizzy water?
questions.explanation:
Perrier.

	Perrier was perhaps the first to persuade consumers that they needed to purchase bottled water.

Hopper.

	He painted 'Nighthawks'.

questions.text: British poet William _______ (1731-1800)? He was a favorite of Jane Austen's. This name ENDS with 'per.'
questions.explanation:
Cowper.

	He wrote a great, funny poem called 'The Retired Cat.' Here's a tiny bit of it: 'A drawer impending o'er the rest, Half-open in the topmost chest, Of depth enough, and none to spare, invited her to slumber there; Puss with delight beyond expression Survey'd the scene and took possession.'

perfection.

	Other synonyms include 'sublimity' and 'impeccability.'

perceptible & perceivable.

	It's also come to be a synonym for 'audible,' as in 'a barely perceptible sigh.'

percent & per cent.

	I want this quiz to be in the top ten percent of all Quizzyland quizzes (but I fear it won't be).

peregrine.

	These falcons are found worldwide but are rare, since pesticides threaten their survival. The can dive on prey at speeds of up to 175 mph! Their sharp, clenched talons kill prey on impact.

perforate.

	Imagine how much more difficult it would be to tear off the part of a bill that you're supposed to send in with your check were it not for perforation.

perplexed.

	Good Scrabble word!

questions.text: In Greek mythology, who is the wife of Hades and the daughter of Demeter and Zeus?
questions.explanation:
Persephone.

	She ate some pomegranate seeds, which doomed her to spend four months per year underground with old Hades. Her mom Demeter (the Earth goddess) mourns during those months, which is why we have winter(according to the Greeks).

persecute.

	Let's wipe out religious persecution. I also wish that church and state would be absolutely separate throughout the world.

questions.text: Eternity? (This is a word that sounds like a scrambled form of 'pituitary,' but actually isn't.)
questions.explanation:
perpetuity.

	I believe this word appears in last wills and testaments.

questions.text: A word that has come to be synonymous with a pretty shade of purplish blue?
questions.explanation:
periwinkle.

	Periwinkle is also an evergreen herb in the dogbane family (some kinds have purplish-blue blooms), and it's been used as a folk remedy for diabetes.
